meanings.definition: To send mail without payment of postage.
meanings.sent1: I franked the letter to my friend so she wouldn't have to pay for postage.
meanings.sent2: She always franked her packages before sending them out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf franked all the envelopes in the mailbox as a prank.
meanings.sent4: His kindness franked his actions with sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stamp franked the permission slip with approval.

meanings.definition: To mark (a piece of mail) with a frank.
meanings.sent1: He carefully franked each envelope with the official stamp.
meanings.sent2: The post office franked the package to indicate it was ready for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to frank the letter with its paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her smile franked the letter with warmth and affection.
meanings.sent5: The ink smudge accidentally franked the envelope, making it illegible.

meanings.definition: A mark or signature on a piece of mail indicating that postage has been paid.
meanings.sent1: The franked stamp on the envelope showed that the postage was covered.
meanings.sent2: She always looked for the franked mark before mailing her letters.
meanings.sent3: The dog's paw print served as a comical frank on the package.
meanings.sent4: The golden seal acted as a royal frank on the important document.
meanings.sent5: The red ink of the franked stamp made the envelope stand out in the mailbox.
